abstract.t: This document specifies a content-type() scheme for use in XPointer-based fragment identifiers. This scheme, like other XPointerFramework [12] schemes, is designed primarily for use with the XMLMedia Types defined in RFC 3023 [5], to identify locations within agiven XML representation of a resource, though it may potentially beused to mix schemes for XML and non-XML representations. Thecontent-type() scheme notifies an XPointer processor whether thecreator of the XPointer intended for a particular pointer part toapply to a resource representation which uses a particular MIMEcontent type identifier.
